javadoc:
Class to identify where help can be located for some object. Help can be
 set on actions or dialogs.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a Help location using the specified topic and anchor names. An html file contained within the specified help topic directory must have an Anchor defined using the specified anchor name.

Note: You can specify a null anchor value. In that case, the given topic will be searched for a file with the same name as the topic. If such a file exists, then that file will be used as the file for this location. If no such file exists, then the help file to use cannot be resolved. Therefore, it is best to always specify a value for the help location. @param topic topic directory name @param anchor anchor name or null
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a Help location using the specified topic and anchor names.
 An html file contained within the specified help topic directory must have an Anchor
 defined using the specified anchor name.
 
 Note:  You can specify a null anchor value.  In that case, the given topic
 will be searched for a file with the same name as the topic.  If such a file exists, 
 then that file will be used as the file for this location.  If no such file exists, then 
 the help file to use cannot be resolved.  Therefore, it is best to always specify
 a value for the help location.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a Help location using the specified topic and anchor names. An html file contained within the specified help topic directory must have an Anchor defined using the specified anchor name.

Note: You can specify a null anchor value. In that case, the given topic will be searched for a file with the same name as the topic. If such a file exists, then that file will be used as the file for this location. If no such file exists, then the help file to use cannot be resolved. Therefore, it is best to always specify a value for the help location. @param topic topic directory name @param anchor anchor name or null @param inceptionInformation the description of from whence the item described by this location has come; can be null
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a Help location using the specified topic and anchor names.
 An html file contained within the specified help topic directory must have an Anchor
 defined using the specified anchor name.
 
 Note:  You can specify a null anchor value.  In that case, the given topic
 will be searched for a file with the same name as the topic.  If such a file exists, 
 then that file will be used as the file for this location.  If no such file exists, then 
 the help file to use cannot be resolved.  Therefore, it is best to always specify
 a value for the help location.

params.name: inceptionInformation
params.comment:
the description of from whence the item 
        described by this location has come; can be null

methods.javadoc:
Get the help ID for this help location.
@return null if there is a Help URL instead of a help ID
methods.name: getHelpId
methods.comment: Get the help ID for this help location.

return.comment: null if there is a Help URL instead of a help ID

methods.javadoc: Returns the topic name/path if known, otherwise null.
methods.name: getTopic
methods.comment: Returns the topic name/path if known, otherwise null.

methods.javadoc: Returns the topic anchor name if known, otherwise null.
methods.name: getAnchor
methods.comment: Returns the topic anchor name if known, otherwise null.

methods.javadoc: Get the help URL for this help location. A URL is created when the constructor HelpLocation(Class, String, String) is used by a plugin that has help relative to its class. @return the URL or null if a help ID is used
methods.name: getHelpURL
methods.comment:
Get the help URL for this help location. A URL is created when the
 constructor HelpLocation(Class, String, String) is
 used by a plugin that has help relative to its class.

return.comment: the URL or null if a help ID is used

methods.name: getInceptionInformation
methods.comment:
Returns information describing how/where this help location was created.  This value may
 be null.

return.comment: information describing how/where this help location was created.

name: HelpLocation
comment:
Class to identify where help can be located for some object. Help can be
 set on actions or dialogs.

fields.javadoc: Flag for lazy-loading the URL value of this class
fields.name: urlInitialized
fields.comment: Flag for lazy-loading the URL value of this class
